text.tspan: number of steps on Motor A and
number of steps on Motor B.
Given point using mm from Motor A spindle (mx, my)
Length A (in stepper motor steps) = SQR(mx*mx + my*my) * spm
Length B (in stepper motor steps = SQR((Machine Width - mx) * (Machine Width - mx) + my*my) * spm
to find the legths A and B using the drawing coordinates (x, y) in mm from (0,0):
in place of mx above use page location.x + margine + x
in place of my above user page location.y + margine + y
An additional transformation is laid over the drawing area to remove differences in paper size used.
The grid size is specified in the configuration file and represents the number of pixels that make up the
width (max x) value of the pixel grid. The pixels are square, so max y value is calculated from the paper
e.g. If decided on a 250 pixel width with paper margin set at 10:
A0 (841 x 1189) would produce a pixel size of (841 - 10 - 10)/250 = 3.284 mm
A1 (594 X 841) would produce a pixel size of (594 - 10 - 10/250 = 2.296 mm
Setting the pixel value to the paper width value gives a pixel grid of 1 mms
